organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

title.gco:CharacterString: 100-Meter Resolution Satellite View with Shaded Relief of Hawaii

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States

otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: These data were downloaded from the National Atlas website (http://www.nationalatlas.gov/atlasftp.html) in August 2014.

collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States of America, 1997-2014

abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Satellite View with Shaded Relief of Hawaii map layer is a 100-meter resolution simulated natural-color image of Hawaii, with relief shading added to accentuate terrain features. Vegetation is generally green, with forests in darker green and grasslands or shrublands in lighter green. Areas of high reflectance, including urban areas, rock, and dry bare soil, are shown in shades of tan and pink. Very bright areas, such as snow and ice, are light blue. The image was produced by combining a mosaic of Landsat Thematic Mapper (TM) imagery from the Landsat 4 and Landsat 5 satellites with shaded relief generated from 100-meter elevation data extracted from the National Elevation Dataset (NED). This layer is part of the 1997-2014 edition National Atlas of the United States.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: The 100-meter resolution satellite view with shaded relief data were developed to portray the ground cover of the United States at 1:1,000,000 scale. The image is intended for visual purposes only. The original Landsat Thematic Mapper imagery data and NED elevation data should be used for conducting analysis. No responsibility is assumed by the National Atlas of the United States in the use of these data.

credit.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States. (2013). 100-Meter Resolution Satellite View with Shaded Relief of Hawaii. National Atlas of the United States. Available at: http://purl.stanford.edu/bc413rh1641.

contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions about this map layer or metadata, please contact the National Atlas using the information above, or through the U.S. Geological Survey contact page at <http://www.usgs.gov/ask/>. For distribution questions, please see the Distribution Information elsewhere in this metadata.

useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey regarding the utility of the data on any other system, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. No responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of these data.

otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This item is in the public domain.

title.gco:CharacterString: National Atlas of the United States of America, 1997-2014

environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: The 100-meter resolution satellite view mosaics and the grayscale shaded relief data that were combined to create this data set are also distributed separately by the National Atlas. Development and characteristics of those data sets is described in their respective metadata. An overview of the Landsat Thematic Mapper (TM) sensor, and links to more detailed information on Landsat can be found at <https://lta.cr.usgs.gov/TM>. More information on the Landsat program can be found in the USGS Fact Sheet, Landsat: A Global Land-Imaging Mission, <http://pubs.usgs.gov/fs/2012/3072/>. More information on NED can be found at <http://ned.usgs.gov>. Included with the GeoTIFF are an information file (.xml), an auxiliary information file (.aux.xml), an image overview file (.ovr), a .tfw file (more information included below), and a .prj file (more information included below.) The contents of the associated world file (.tfw) are: >100.0 >0.0 >0.0 >-100.0 >-402950.0 >2164950.0 The projection (.prj) file contains the following information: > PROJCS["Albers_NAD83_ Hawaii ", >GEOGCS["GCS_North_American_1983", >DATUM["D_North_American_1983", >SPHEROID["GRS_1980",6378137.0,298.257222101]], >PRIMEM["Greenwich",0.0], >UNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433]], >PROJECTION["Albers"], >PARAMETER["False_Easting",0.0], >PARAMETER["False_Northing",0.0], >PARAMETER["Central_Meridian",-157.0], >PARAMETER["Standard_Parallel_1",8.0], >PARAMETER["Standard_Parallel_2",18.0], >PARAMETER["Latitude_Of_Origin",3.0], >UNIT["Meter",1.0]] Data set extent in meters (Albers Equal-Area Conic projection) >North 2165000 >West -403000 >East 303000 >South 1723000 There are no NULL or NODATA values in the GeoTIFF. Instead, all elevation values in oceans have been set to zero as part of the masking process. Information about National Atlas Web services can be found on the Web Map and Web Feature Services page; see <http://nationalatlas.gov/infodocs/webservices.html>.

gml:UnitDefinition.gml:identifier: Unified Code of Units of Measure

measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: No tests for logical consistency have been performed on this map layer.
Data completeness reflects the content of the original image and elevation data.

description.gco:CharacterString: The Satellite View with Shaded Relief image is a combination of the Satellite View and Grayscale Shaded Relief map layers that are distributed by the National Atlas of the United States. Characteristics and development of those two data sets are documented in their respective metadata. They were combined in the following steps: In Photoshop, a new image was created in CMYK color mode. Color separation settings were set to UCR, No black generation, 300 percent maximum CMY. The RGB National Atlas HI Satellite View 2013 image was opened and the Red band selected, copied, and pasted in its entirety into the Cyan band of the new image; the Green band was pasted into the Magenta band of the new image and the Blue band was copied into the Yellow band of the new image. National Atlas HI Grayscale Shaded Relief 2013 was copied and pasted into the Black band of the new image. Color separation settings were re-set to UCR, Maximum black generation, 400 percent maximum CMYK. The new CMYK image was then converted to RGB to create the final image. Ocean areas were set to an RGB value of (193,224,250). Non-U.S. areas were set to a RGB value of (240,235,211).
